activities.loc: Br 10 - Law Enforcement Center - West Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Saleena D Bland

records.addlTxt: Review hearing on January 27, 2023 at 11:00 am.
Letter to Court regarding admission to MMHI

2:02 PM Defendant Saleena D Bland in court.  Attorney McKenna Marie Quinter in court for Saleena D Bland.  Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Tanck-Adams in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter: Sara Rogan. 
Matter moved up to address letter filed by DHS. 
Defense indicates they are objecting to the defendant to be taken into custody today and have a bed available on Monday. 
State has not seen the letter so will not take a position on this. 
BTC: Court will not take the defendant in as long as she goes on Monday. Matter set over for review.
Review hearing scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Review hearing on October 28, 2022 at 09:30 am.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt:
Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. No contact with the victim E.M, N.M, J.M, and A.M(person, property, residence or family). No possession or use o any device with internet access with an exception to use for school purposes only.

AMENDED 9/19/22 to allow electronic communication with her attorney and service providers in addition to school.

9:34 AM Defendant Saleena D Bland in court.  Attorney McKenna Marie Quinter in court for Saleena D Bland.  Prosecuting attorney Brooke L Erickson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Sara Rogan. 
Competency report on file. 
Defense has reviewed report and are not contesting. 
State has reviewed report and not contesting. 
BTC: Defendant is not competent at this time, matter set over for review. 
Defense requests bond be modified to allow electronic communication with her attorney and service providers in addition to school.
Review hearing scheduled for December 13, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Review hearing on December 13, 2022 at 11:00 am.
